thread.title: Missouri’s Harris added to Bednarik Award watch list
thread.title_full: Missouri’s Harris added to Bednarik Award watch list - KCTV5

author: Posted by DeAnn Smith, Digital Content Manager
title: Missouri’s Harris added to Bednarik Award watch list
text:
COLUMBIA, MO (FOOTBALLKC) - When the 2015 season began, the Missouri coaching staff hoped that redshirt sophomore Charles Harris would be the next big name from the university that has produced numerous first round picks and NFL starters during coach Gary Pinkel's tenure. 
Harris has taken every step to fulfill his potential this season and was recognized for his tremendous play when he was selected as nominee for the Chuck Bednarik award, given to the nation’s defensive player of the year. The nomination was announced by the Maxwell Football Club on Thursday.
The initial nominees were selected based on their performance during the 2014 season, but Harris was one of the 13 additional nominees selected due to their performance thus far in the 2015 season. Harris joins teammate Kentrell Brothers on the list.
Harris leads the SEC in tackles for a loss with 11.5 and ranks seventh in the SEC with 4.0 sacks. The sophomore has played a large part in the Tigers leading the SEC and ranking third nationally in tackles for a loss, leading a young defensive line that lost Harold Brantley, arguably the team’s most talented defender, to a season ending injury before the season.
Semifinalists for the Bednarik Award will be announced on Nov. 2 and three finalists will be announced Nov. 24.
The winner of the 2015 Bednarik Awards will be announced as part of the Home Depot College Football Awards Show which will be held on Dec 10 at the College Football Hall of Fame in Atlanta. The formal presentation of these awards will be made at the Maxwell Football Club Awards Gala hosted by Tropicana Hotel & Casino Atlantic City on March 11.
